text:
hello everyone in this video I'm going to show 
you how you can make your own homemade five-spice

powder blend now five-spice powder is technically 
a Chinese ingredient but we use quite a bit of

it in Thai cuisine as well and I actually used 
it in my five-spice roasted cauliflower recipe

and so this video is an extension of that one so 
these are all the spices that go into my version

of five-spice powder or what we call palm Paulo 
in Thai now yes I know there are six spices here

don't panic five is just a guideline even the 
ones that you buy from the grocery store not all

of them will have five some of them even have 
three which I always be ripped off but anyway

of all the spices in front of me the two that 
you absolutely have to have if you're making

pommes pulao is cinnamon and star anis okay you 
cannot have five-spice powder without cinnamon

and star anise cinnamon will give you that nice 
warm sweet smell that we're all familiar with and

star nice gives a liquid Chi flavor that can be 
a bit overpowering so that's why I'm only using

one okay the third most important one I would say 
is coriander seeds and it's got that orange pili

citrusy aroma absolutely love it I didn't toast it 
I like to keep my spice blend raw so that when I

add it to dishes I'm going to be cooking it most 
of the time anyway cloves I love clove it's got

that sweet a little bit fruity Christmassy smell 
and I think it really sort of rounds out the other

stronger liquor chi flavor from the star nice 
really well the next - I consider optional if you

want to stop at these four absolutely fine fennel 
seeds a liquor chi flavor similar to star nice but

it's it's milder it's a little bit of a sweeter 
liqueur genus finally Sichuan peppercorns which

is famous for its sort of numbing pepperiness 
it's not I can actually give you any numbing

sensation in this blend so those are all my spices 
and all I'm going to do is put them into my spice

grinder or a coffee grinder or you could go 
old school and do mortar and pestle as well

that looks nice and fine and it smells so good 
now at this point take a smell if you don't

like it if you feel like it needs a little 
more cinnamon a little more clothes you can

adjust it at this point it's one of those 
things everybody's recipe is different now

you want to store this in an airtight container 
and I wouldn't make any more than this much at a

time because spices are fresher when they're 
kept whole and now you have your own unique

five-spice powder blend which you can use in 
soups as a marinade spice rub so many things

you can do with it put it on vegetables like 
my roasted cauliflower recipe or show me how

you like to use five-spice powder you can send 
me photos on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and

I'll make sure to include a sample both in 
my newsletter if you haven't signed up for

the newsletter it is on hot I kitchen calm 
which is also where the recipe will be and

if you haven't subscribed to the YouTube 
channel please go ahead and do so and I

will see you next time for your next delicious 
tiny there are six spices ah lies that touch
